channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jared Isaacman confirmed as next head of NASA
item.description: Isaacman will run the space agency at a time when Trump is trying to both downsize it and task it with returning astronauts to the Moon.

item.title: Bluesky launches a privacy-focused ‘find friends’ feature without invite spam
item.description: The Bluesky contact matching feature is opt-in and your data won't be used to spam your friends, the social network says.

item.title: YouTube to pull music data from Billboard’s charts because it doesn’t like its ranking formula
item.description: YouTube takes its ball and goes home by pulling Billboard's access to its music data.

item.title: Coursera and Udemy enter a merger agreement valued at around $2.5B
item.description: Coursera and Udemy, two of the biggest names in online learning, are combining platforms next year.

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery rejects Paramount’s hostile bid, calls offer ‘illusory’
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery called Paramount's offer "illusory" and said that the company had misled shareholders about its financing.

item.title: Cisco says Chinese hackers are exploiting its customers with a new zero-day
item.description: Cisco said it discovered a Chinese hacking campaign targeting its customers by exploiting a zero-day in some of the company's most popular products.

item.title: YouTube will stream the Oscars — exclusively — beginning in 2029
item.description: The news highlights YouTube's growing dominance in the television space and a major shift as streaming takes on more live events.

item.title: Meta is pausing its dream of sharing Quest’s Horizon OS with third-party headset makers
item.description: The company said that it would revisit opportunities for third-party partnerships in the future.

item.title: Mozilla’s new CEO says AI is coming to Firefox, but will remain a choice
item.description: Mozilla has appointed Anthony Enzor-DeMeo as its CEO, as the Firefox developer scrambles to adapt in a rapidly changing browser market.

item.title: Google launches Gemini 3 Flash, makes it the default model in the Gemini app
item.description: Google is making Gemini 3 Flash the default model in the Gemini app and oAI model for Search
